results.title: Attack Force Z
results.brief_description: Hidden on a small Pacific Island is a man with a secret that could end the Second World War and the killer elite Attack Force Z is sent in to get him out… or die in the attempt.

results.title: Atonement
results.creator_credit: Michael McKennirey, George Pearson, Canadian Wildlife Service and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Ten million buffalo once roamed the plains of North America but now, only a few carefully protected herds remain. The carrier pigeon, the whooping crane and other species have fallen prey to the greatest predator, man. This program shows efforts by wildlife specialists to preserve and nurture the creatures that remain in the wilderness areas. Scenes rarely photographed are included in this spellbinding documentary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael McKennirey, George Pearson, Canadian Wildlife Service and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Australia's urban wildlife
results.creator_credit: Deborah Boerne, Janet Lane, ABC-TV (Australia) and Victoria. Dept. of Conservation
results.brief_description: As seen on the ABC’s “Behind The News” program, this video looks at the ways in which Australia’s native wildlife habitat has been altered by urban development. It also examines the ways in which students and teachers can learn about and value their local fauna. “Our hidden neighbours” is an introduction to native wildlife in urban areas and highlights the effect of urban development on wildlife. “Nocturnal visitors” looks at some of the native nocturnal wildlife found in urban areas. “The Feral menace” explores the problems that introduced animal species have caused for native wildlife. “Attracting wildlife” shows ways of attracting wildlife to your own backyard.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Deborah Boerne, Janet Lane, ABC-TV (Australia) and Victoria. Dept. of Conservation

results.title: Australia's New Faces 1969 Grand Final
results.creator_credit: Desmond Tester, John Proper, Peter Faiman and GTV9 Melbourne
results.brief_description: Out of 328 acts judged throughout 1969 are the 12 finalists. The winner will receive a $5,000 contract with the Nine Network. The winners - The Paul MacKay Sound; the judges - John Laws, Geoff Brook, Tom Miller, Pat London, Jim McKay. Hosted by Terry Dear and Frank Wilson, voice over by Pete Smith and sponsored by Kevin Dennis. Performing Contestants include Paul Mackay Sound and Mike McClellan.

results.title: Atomic juggernaut
results.creator_credit: Eugene Boyko, Tom Daly, Walford Hewitson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In India they call it Anushkati - the atomic juggernaut - a modern miracle brought from Canada to light an entire region. This film shows the strange procession made by the calandria, the heart of the nuclear reactor, hauled by huge diesel tractors from the seaport in India to the proposed site of the reactor, along a roadway specially prepared beforehand. Everywhere the juggernaut passed, ancient life stopped for a moment to witness the arrival of this new deity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eugene Boyko, Tom Daly, Walford Hewitson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Australia's Great Barrier Reef
results.creator_credit: David Hannan, David Reed, Janine Hedley, Russell Kelley, David Hannan Productions and Television New Zealand Natural History Unit
results.brief_description: Australia’s Great Barrier Reef is a visually vibrant documentary about the strange summer mating rituals that have resulted in the formation of one of the most stunning natural wonders of the world. A spectacular and sometimes surreal celebration of coral and reef society in general, focusing on the tactics used to perpetuate the species. Originally screened as “Sex of the Reef”. Winner of Golden Tripod Award for Wildlife and Nature at 25th Australian International Cinematographers Society Awards, and Gold Award Nature and Wildlife at the US International Film and Video Festival 1993.

results.title: Aussie fit: getting started
results.creator_credit: Debbie Hides, Bryan Lowe, John Novak and BM International
results.brief_description: This gentle routine for beginners is designed for all shapes, sizes and ages to burn off that excess weight and to gently tone flagging muscles. Follow the exercises at your own pace and gradually work up to a level that suits your individual needs. Also included is a bonus stretch section that shows how to achieve flexibility and suppleness throughout the body. WARNING: Please take note and heed the cautionary warning at the beginning of this video.

results.title: Auslan for families [five stories]
results.creator_credit: Raffi Ghazarian, Chisholm Institute Education Development Unit and VSDC Services for Deaf Children
results.brief_description: Companion piece to ‘Auslan for families: vocabulary. Episodes 1-5’ [313556], in which the signs demonstrated there are acted out in five scenes of varying length around the themes of family, school, shopping, food and play. Intended as a language teaching program for parents of deaf children from a non-English speaking background; a voiceover accompanies the signing. Performers include: Kathryn Smith, Gerard Hynes, Caitlyn Johnson, Trent Beasly.

results.title: Atlantic parks = Parcs Atlantique
results.creator_credit: Andre Belleau, Jacques Bobet and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An exploration of three of Canada’s National Parks; Fundy, Prince Edward Island and Cape Breton Highlands, all on the Atlantic coast, where, by filmmaker’s licence’ boy meets girl, marries and has a family, all while enjoying the park’s many other rewards for autocampers. Even the girl’s little white car, which leads us to the parks at the outset, seems to run on the pure air and the anticipation of fresh adventures around the next turn.

results.title: Attiuk
results.creator_credit: Rene Bonniere, Pierre Perrault and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: To understand the life of the Montagnais, you have to walk twelve days on snowshoes as far as Lake Musquaro in search of the caribou, following a dream contained within the skins of the drum that the elders patiently craft, like a canoe. The hunters hunt the caribou, which provide the skins for their drums which give them their dreams, which brings them the caribou.
